text: <@U1BC5NF2S> , we need to include Power node into the community CI, could you please let me know the process for this? <@U11HH3P7Y> already created a patch in ci-management for this.
<@U12V3D2P2> : I haven't pushed that to ci-management.. Will do that in 1 hour..
Thanks <@U11HH3P7Y>
<@U0KPFAZNF>: I am able to proceed further from common.sh on dockerv1.12 ... I observed this in one of the softlayer machine
I am not sure why this is not working in LF jenkins environment..
<@U11HH3P7Y|ramesh> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/ramesh/F27CF5M5W/docker_v1.12|docker v1.12>

text:
<@U1BC5NF2S> :  Builds are failing with error ```00:03:51.344 The following packages have unmet dependencies:
00:03:51.344  default-jre : Depends: default-jre-headless (= 2:1.7-51) but it is not going to be installed
00:03:51.344                Depends: openjdk-7-jre (>= 7~u3-2.1.1) but it is not going to be installed```
can you please check this <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/view/fabric/job/fabric-merge-x86_64/123/console>
<@U11HH3P7Y> What's the issue with docker 1.12?
I'll look into the JDK issue as well
builds are not proceeding further while updating ubuntu pakages from here <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/master/scripts/provision/common.sh> on docker v1.12 version..
last week <@U0UHG4VP1> upgraded docker version in Jenkins to v1.12 to fix couple of behave test failures but we encountered with this one..
<@U11HH3P7Y> i speculate that the jre-headless thing might be improved with <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/817/>
can you confirm?
yes this might fix that issue but to confirm this issue is not reproducing here..
Will check in another machine and let you know..
Huh,  okay, so this is not an issue with the build servers
<@U1BC5NF2S>: the JRE-headless error?  I'm not sure what's causing it yet, but there is anecdotal evidence that some mirrors are flaky
We never had that problem before so I speculate the mirror config might be the reason
<@U0KPFAZNF> I merged that revert didn’t I?
i thought so, but it was to master
sorry, i was on mobile so I couldnt confirm where ramesh was seeing that
I should have said “confirm if it happens after the merge"
I see the patch is merged.. but I am seeing JDK and ubuntu package update (on dockerv1.12.0) issues only in Jenkins build machines..
<@U1BC5NF2S> : Could you please merge this <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/833/> to verify node-sdk-unit-tests..
<@U11HH3P7Y> Merged :slightly_smiling_face:
Thank you..
<@U11HH3P7Y> ah, interesting
maybe it is a CI specific problem then
added an integration to this channel: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/services/B27E40VB8|incoming-webhook>
<@U11HH3P7Y> i think there is a problem with coupling to “make unit-tests"
just saw this: <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/job/fabric-verify-x86_64/823/console>
yes about to ping you..
i assume something was merged to the ci-tree that assumes “unit-tests” is a universal target?
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/673/> -- this patch has to update in all other branches
that decoupling seems a bit dangerous to me
i can rebase that patch though
Otherwise Will do this <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/859/>
It's better to rebase that in all the branches..
ok, done
(at least for 807
will need to re-evaluate my other patches
yes Thank you

Trevor Bramwell proposed
>>>ci-management (master): [DO NOT MERGE]  Test Slack Integration (<http://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/865>)
Hey, look at that it works!
This will probably need to be configured per-project.
fabric changes go to <#C0Y4PEU22|fabric>, etc.
And ci-management changes go here

<@U0KM61BCP> <@U0KPFAZNF> <@U0ULK2JPP>  have to incorporate changes in node-sdk patch (<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/673/>) in all other branches and existing open patches needs rebase..
I'll pick up the slack integration stuff tomorrow, have to put out some fires. :slightly_smiling_face:
ok thank you..
<@U1BC5NF2S> we had <#C11SL9YDV|fabric-ci-status> for previous slack integration for fabric
Oh, right! I'll use that channel then.
thx
First complete build with all three tests (unit-tests, node-sdk and Behave) <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/job/fabric-merge-x86_64/125/>
now, if we could get past these unstable builds
the build is pissing me off
we really need <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/859/1> merged ASAP
<@U0KM61BCP> <@U0KPFAZNF> we have to revert <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/833/> this patch to make this work
or we have to merge <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/869/> & <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/871/> these two patches in v0.6 & feature/convergence branches
